Description: Cast ring in copper alloy with projecting (rectangular?) bezel; no discernable detail; highly corroded.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Redpath Museum, Montreal. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Despite the heavy corrosion, this ring may have a bezel of Boardman’s (1970, fig. 217) type XIV of the late 4th century BC or later. Boardman, J. 1970, Greek Gems and Finger-rings: Early Bronze Age to Late Classical, New York.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QA.09)
